class_notes:
(Complete Topic - Crossroads Course--Beyond Borders: Gender, Health, & Art in Latin America and South Asia)
What are the similarities and differences in gender and health intersections in Latin America and South Asia? How do literature, film, and media represent the connections between gender and health in these contexts? Through critical reflection, this seminar will introduce students to interdisciplinary theories, research, case studies, literary writings, films, and media primarily in Latin America and South Asia.  
The first class meeting will be on September 2, and it will conclude after five consecutive sessions.
course_description: A side-car course brings together a subset of students from two courses that overlap in methodologies, topics, etc., to create a short interdisciplinary course that runs simultaneously with its two sponsoring courses. One credit, S/U only. Schedule and format arranged by sponsoring professors.
sections: Class Nbr: 6031, Section #: 5, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: F 2-5p, Instructor: Sharma/Duarte Salinas, Status: Open
